e4: Change of policy to one that truthfully reports unbiased earnings is crucial for maintaining long term stability and public trust in the company. While transition periods can be challenging, clear communication with investors about the reasons behind the change in reporting is essential.
e5: The new, unbiased earnings reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, full accounting of all revenues and expenses, compliance with GAAP standards, consistency, transparency in its application and communication to the investing public. Additionally, it should mitigate any potential negative impacts on smaller, more innocent investors and avoid giving an advantage to sophisticated hedge funds who are better positioned to understand the nuances.
